channel.title: Can Someone help me Compiling Error
channel.description:
Please help IDK What to do the error is :
'"C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.7.0_02\javac.exe"' Is not recognized as an internal or external command, operable program or batch file. press any key to continue. . .
Please can someone help me :) that is my Right JDK

item.title: Can Someone help me Compiling Error
item.dc:creator: @ultimatepkvillage ultimatepkvillage
item.description:
@ultimatepkvillage wrote:

[quote=“MrRspsMan, post:1, topic:427672”]Please help IDK What to do the error is :

'“C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.7.0_02\javac.exe”'Is not recognized as an internal or external command,operable program or batch file.
press any key to continue. . .[/quote]

Maybe because you added an apostrophe ’ which is not needed

—>[size=10pt]’[/size]“C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.7.0_02\javac.exe”[size=10pt]’[/size]<—

it should be this

“C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.7.0_02\javac.exe”

Read full topic
item.source: Can Someone help me Compiling Error

item.title: Can Someone help me Compiling Error
item.dc:creator: @frozon566 frozon566
item.description:
@frozon566 wrote:

open up your CMD (hit your start icon & type in “cmd” and hit enter)
type in “javac” and hit enter.

if it returns with nearly the same error as your getting now “javac is not recognized…”
follow this video: [youtube]http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Hl-zzrqQoSE[/youtube]

if after you hit enter it returns a giant list of stuff then do this…

right-click on your compiler and click edit.

copy and paste everything inside of it here.
also go to: http://www.oracle.com/technetwork/java/javase/downloads/index.html

and download the latest jdk release so we dont have to deal with figuring out what ure jdk version is.

Read full topic
item.source: Can Someone help me Compiling Error

item.title: Can Someone help me Compiling Error
item.dc:creator: @MrRspsMan MrRspsMan
item.description:
@MrRspsMan wrote:

Nonamee:

If this is for your client folder, how is it set up? (Do you have seperate folders for the files, like bin for class files, and src for java files? Class/Java? Or is it all in one folder combined? .Class, .java, .bat, how is it set up?)

it is in the server file

Read full topic
